formatted_in_depth_analysis.statement: Single-atom Co sites coordinated on partially oxidized graphene nanosheets enable efficient visible-light-driven CO₂ reduction due to strong metal-support interactions and enhanced electron transfer.
Optimizing the reduction degree of graphene supports and Co coordination environments maximizes catalytic activity, achieving a turnover frequency (TOF) of 3.77 min⁻¹ for CO production.
